summary: This is an internal email chain from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, dated October 4, 2019, regarding a request for data on human trafficking victim interviews. The email mentions Jeffrey Epstein in passing as a reference point for the request.

persons.name: Kurland, Abigail
persons.role: Assistant United States Attorney, Human Trafficking Co-Coordinator
persons.context: Appears as the sender of an email within the chain, identified as an AUSA and Human Trafficking Co-Coordinator in the Money Laundering & Transnational Criminal Enterprise Unit of the SDNY.

persons.name: Epstein, Jeffrey
persons.context: Mentioned in passing as a reference point in the subject line of an internal email ('Other than Epstein, we would have'), indicating his case is a known context for the office's work.

events.title: Internal SDNY Data Request on Trafficking Victims
events.description: An internal email request is sent within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York asking units to report the average number of unique human trafficking victims or potential victims interviewed in the past year.

keyFacts: The document is an internal email from the SDNY's Money Laundering & Transnational Criminal Enterprise Unit dated October 4, 2019.
The email chain includes a request for data on human trafficking victim interviews conducted by various units, with a deadline of the close of business that Friday.
Jeffrey Epstein is mentioned in the subject line ('Other than Epstein, we would have'), indicating his case was a significant reference point for the office's human trafficking work.
Abigail Kurland is identified as an Assistant U.S. Attorney and the Human Trafficking Co-Coordinator for the SDNY.
The request seeks a rough average of victim interviews, regardless of whether cases were charged, to 'get a sense of volume.'
